question: Question_04
statement:
You are driving your car at 30 m/sec (approximately 108 km/hr) to catch
your flight to Costa Rica for summer holidays. A pedestrian runs across
the road, forcing you to break hard. Suppose it takes you 1 sec to react
to the danger, and that when you apply your brakes, you slow down at the
rate a = -10 m/$\text{sec}^{2}$. After applying the brakes, how long
will it take you to stop? How far will your car move from the instant
that the danger is sighted until coming to a complete stop?
